I'm happy to provide you with detailed information about paternity leave. Here is everything you need to know:

**Entitlements & Eligibility:**

- You are entitled to two weeks of paternity leave following the birth of your child. 
- You must inform HR Representative of your intention to take paternity leave by the end of the 15th week before the baby is expected. 
- You will be required to supply the week the baby is due, whether you wish to take one or two weeks leave, and when you want your leave to start.

**Complete Procedures:**

1. Inform HR Representative of your intention to take paternity leave by the end of the 15th week before the baby is expected.
2. Provide the following information in writing:
   - The week the baby is due;
   - Whether you wish to take one or two weeks leave;
   - When you want your leave to start.
3. You can change your mind about the date on which you want your leave to start, providing you inform HR Representative in writing at least 28 days in advance.
4. Inform HR Representative in writing of the date you expect Paternity Leave Payments to start at least 28 days in advance.

**Documentation Requirements:**

- Written notification to HR Representative of your intention to take paternity leave.
- Written details of the week the baby is due, leave duration, and start date.

**Timeframes & Deadlines:**

- Inform HR Representative by the end of the 15th week before the baby is expected.
- Provide written details at least 28 days before the start date of your leave.

**Important Considerations:**

- If the period of leave taken is more than 26 weeks, when added to any other period of shared parental leave, statutory maternity or paternity leave taken in respect of the same child, or was the last of two or more consecutive periods of statutory leave that included a period of ordinary parental leave of more than four weeks, or a period of additional maternity leave, you have the right to return to the same job unless it is not reasonably practicable.
- If it is not reasonably practicable for the company to allow a return to the same job, you have the right to return to another job that is suitable and appropriate for you.

**Next Steps:**

1. Inform HR Representative of your intention to take paternity leave by the end of the 15th week before the baby is expected.
2. Provide written details of the week the baby is due, leave duration, and start date to HR Representative at least 28 days before your leave starts.

Hope this helps!

Sources: Paternity-Leave-Policy-Birth.docx
